Posts.Content: Georgev wrote: Hi all My wife is 39 years old and she was initially diagnosed with stage II BC on June 2009 ( 4 years ago). Unfortunately, 2 days ago we found out that there is metastasis on liver and bones, multiple spots on both. Our oncologist adviced us to go through a therapy of Avastin and Xeloda (cycles of Avastin every 3 weeks and Xeloda for 14 consecutive days with one week stop). For us its a HUGE shock since we believed that she was almost free from the disease. We would be really appreciate anyinformation on the following - what shall we expect from now on? What is the life expectancy? - shall we visit any BC center in US and / or Europe. Have you got any recommendations? - any recommendation for BC specialist who can involve my wife to any new protocol? - I know that Avastin is prohibited in US but it is still used in Europe. What is your opinion to use it? Is there any other alternative or better treatment to suggest to our oncologists? Really thank you for your replies. George Dx 6/1/2009, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/19 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 6/1/2009 Lymph node removal: Right; Mastectomy: Right Chemotherapy 6/15/2009 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Ellence (epirubicin), Fluorouracil (5-fluorouracil, 5-FU, Adrucil), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 10/4/2009 Breast Hormonal Therapy 11/1/2009 Log in to post a reply
